task_summary: A robot arm is tasked with picking up a shoe from a blue surface, using perception, approach, verification, and grasp actions.

task_long_description.overview: The episode centers on a robot arm equipped with a wrist camera attempting to pick up a lone white shoe from a blue background. The robot uses its perception system to detect and localize the shoe, approaches above it, computes a grasp pose (likely from the side given the shoe shape and orientation), and performs a grasp using the gripper. The contact-sheet sequence appears to document the robot's approach, alignment, and closing phases. No evidence of placement is in scope; the goal is solely object acquisition.
preconditions: Shoe is present and visible on a blue surface
stepwise_plan: Verify visibility of the shoe or scan if needed
Move to a pre-grasp position above the shoe
Compute a suitable side grasp pose
Approach and align with the grasp pose
Confirm shoe is secured in gripper
success_criteria: Shoe is grasped and held securely by the gripper
No major disturbance or drop of the shoe
failure_and_recovery: Shoe not detected: rescan with ScanForTarget
Grasp unsuccessful: retry approach or adjust pose
Object slips during grasp: abort and retry
task_long_description.termination: Task terminates once the shoe is held securely in the gripper (ObjectInGripper condition true).

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks whether the shoe is currently visible by perception.
Performs a raster scan to locate the shoe, up to 3 attempts.
Opens the gripper to 0.06m for pre-grasp.
Moves above the shoe by 0.05m in z before grasping.
Computes a grasp pose from the side for the shoe.
Approaches and aligns with the shoe at a tight tolerance.
Executes a grasp at the computed pose using the side strategy.
Checks if the shoe is now held in the gripper.

failure_modes: Gripper fails to fully open or close
recovery_strategy: Rescan for shoe if not visible
Retry grasp if ObjectInGripper is false
Abort and alert if repeated failures
assumptions: The shoe is the primary object and always present in frames.
No indication of transfer/place phases; task ends after grasp.
Grasp appears best suited as 'side' based on shoe orientation and grasping geometry.
No explicit force setting (library omitted direct force in GraspAtPose); inferred from visual.

expected_success_criteria: Shoe is detected and picked up cleanly
No loss of object during sequence
Pick robust against moderate perception uncertainty
